isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 5000, 9300 AND 9400 SERIES - MAINTENANCE - INSPECTION

svcproc.title: INSPECTION
svcproc.para:
At the time of vehicle chassis lubrication, check clutch pedal free travel. If free travel is less than the specified dimension listed under SPECIFICATIONS
, make necessary adjustments (refer to ADJUSTMENT
.

At least once each year and in the event of clutch service, inspect the clutch control linkage for worn or damaged parts. Worn yoke pins and yoke pin holes in the control rods and levers could affect linkage adjustment and clutch operation. Replace any worn or damaged parts. When installing new parts, the clutch linkage should be lubricated and readjusted.
